ovdesc.p: This file holds the details of the system wide parameters that are required to run the DFE Frame Work.
The table should captured for each interface that need to do the extraction / upload / real-time inward data flow and real time outward.
In addition to that the record can configured with unique file path where the file needs to get extract or path to pick the file for upload.
OFS Source ID , USername Company Code to process the OFS message can configure in this table.

desc.p: Describes when this Parameter record is used, ie. what the Message Type means, and the reason for the sub-classification.
Descriptions may be entered in each of the languages defined in the LANGUAGE table.
Validation Rules
3-35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Multilanguage field. (Mandatory input)
Identifies the type of an interface.
The valid values are IN_OUT.
Which identifies INWARD or OUTWARD data process.
Validation Rule
Mandatory field for all kind of interfaces.
Identifies the mode of an outward real-time interface.
The valid values are EACH.MSG.SYNC_EACH.MSG.ASYNC_FINAL.MSG.SYNC_FINAL.MSG.ASYNC.
Which identifies mode of transaction for real-time outward.
Validation Rule
Mandatory field when IN.OUT.TYPE set as OUT and MODE.OF.TXN set as ONLINE.
This field identifies the Inward processing method for real-time / off-line file process.
Valid values are OFS / FLAT.WRITE / FLAT.UPDATE
Validation Rule
Mandatory field for all kind of interfaces.
Identifies the record delimiter for a file whether it's a inward file process or file extraction.
Default this will take as line feed or we can say it as FM marker for each line.
Identifies the record id of DFE.MAPPING table.
Validation Rules
Should be existing in DFE.MAPPING.
The MAPPING ID mentioned in the DFE PARAMETER will take first precedence if mapping id is not keyed it will take interface id as mapping id.
Normalized record delimiter. Default is Linefeed.
The user credentials used to post the OFS message for real time data processing.
Validation rules. Should be a valid user record.
The configured OFS Source used for inward real-time / off-line file processing.
Validation Rule. - This field is mandatory when the field IN.OUT.TYPE set as IN. - The data mentioned in this field is cross validated against OFS.SOURCE.
The configured OFS version used for inward real-time / off-line file processing.
Validation Rule. - This field is mandatory when the field IN.OUT.TYPE set as IN. - The data mentioned in this field is cross validated against VERSION.
This field should be configured with routine alone to perform a pre validation before processing a file.
This field will applied only for inward off-line file processing alone.
If the incoming data has any header and trailer that should be removed by attaching a user defined routine in field
Validation Rule (Optional Input) This field should prefixed with @ ALONG with routine name. Ex @SUBROUTINE.NAME.XXXXX
This field should be configured to restrict the generation of empty file from T24 if no records are available for extraction.
This field will applied only for outward file extraction process.
By default, the field will be blank and empty file will be generated. If the field value is set to N then empty file will not be generated
Validation Rule (Optional Input) The field either accepts blank value or N
The field should hold a valid path to pick the inward file to process.
This is a conditional mandatory field when the field UPLOAD.METHOD is keyed in.
Validation Rules

This is mandatory field for inward file processing and this should validated against in the current environment.
example:- if the field configured as, bnk/!MNE/!TODAY - DFE will REPLACE as bnk/BNK/20140101

td.p: Replaces Today's date in YYMMDD format
Replaces last working day from Dates record
Replaces last working day from Dates record
Replaces Today's date in JULIAN format.
Replaces System time in HH:MM format.
Replaces System time in HH:MM:SS format.
Replaces by local currency from Company record.
Replaces by number of lines for Extract (only for trailer records).

desc.p: The field should hold a valid path to extract the outward file.
This is a conditional mandatory field when the field IN.OUT.TYPE is keyed in as OUT.
Validation Rules
This is mandatory field for OUTWARD file extract and this should validated against in the current environment.

This field also allow to key in the basic T24 common variables as listed below, example:- if the field configured as, bnk/!COMPANY/!ID - DFE will REPLACE as bnk/GB0010001/ACCOUNT.EXTRACT (ACCOUNT.EXTRACT is a DFE.PARAMETER ID)

td.p: Replaces Today's date in YYMMDD format
Replaces last working day from Dates record
Replaces last working day from Dates record
Replaces Today's date in JULIAN format.
Replaces System time in HH:MM format.
Replaces System time in HH:MM:SS format.
Replaces by local currency from Company record.
Replaces by number of lines for Extract (only for trailer records).

desc.p: The field should hold a valid path to archive the inward file after processing.
This is a conditional mandatory field when the field UPLOAD.METHOD is keyed in.
Validation Rules
This is mandatory field to archive the inward file and this should validated against in the current environment.
This field also allow to key in the basic T24 common variables as listed below, example:- if the field configured as, bnk/!MNE/!LCCY - DFE will REPLACE as bnk/BNK/GBP

td.p: Replaces Today's date in YYMMDD format
Replaces last working day from Dates record
Replaces last working day from Dates record
Replaces Today's date in JULIAN format.
Replaces System time in HH:MM format.
Replaces System time in HH:MM:SS format.
Replaces by local currency from Company record.
Replaces by number of lines for Extract (only for trailer records).

desc.p: This is a optional field to define the inward file name to process specifically or if this is left blank the DFE will do the SELECT and process the files present in the INFILE.DIR.
This FIELD is applicable when the IN.OUT.TYPE set as IN.
Valid Data
1. Will be a Static ID ex. Account.csv
2. Can be like ACCOUNT.!MNE.!TODAY.csv - DFE REPLACES with ACCOUNT.BNK.2014010.csv
3. @SUBROUTINENAME.XXXX
4. Blank to select all the files present in the folder.
5. Common Variables can used as listed below, example:- if the field configured as, CUSTOMER-!MNE-!TODAY.txt - DFE will REPLACE as CUSTOMER-BNK-20140101.txt

td.p: Replaces Today's date in YYMMDD format
Replaces last working day from Dates record
Replaces last working day from Dates record
Replaces Today's date in JULIAN format.
Replaces System time in HH:MM format.
Replaces System time in HH:MM:SS format.
Replaces by local currency from Company record.
Replaces by number of lines for Extract (only for trailer records).

desc.p: This is a mandatory field for the IN.OUT.TYPE set as OUT.
This FIELD is applicable when the IN.OUT.TYPE set as OUT.
Valid Data
1. Will be a Static ID ex. Account.csv
2. Can be like ACCOUNT.!MNE.!TODAY.csv - DFE REPLACES with ACCOUNT.BNK.2014010.csv
3. Common Variables can used as listed below, example:- if the field configured as, CUSTOMER-!MNE-!TODAY.txt - DFE will REPLACE as CUSTOMER-BNK-20140101.txt

td.p: Replaces Today's date in YYMMDD format
Replaces last working day from Dates record
Replaces last working day from Dates record
Replaces Today's date in JULIAN format.
Replaces System time in HH:MM format.
Replaces System time in HH:MM:SS format.
Replaces by local currency from Company record.
Replaces by number of lines for Extract (only for trailer records).

desc.p: Allowed only if IN.OUT.TYPE is set to OUT. Defines the header details of the file being processed. Should translate all the keywords as mentioned in IN.FILE.NAME. Can also be user defined routine with ‘@’ prefixed with 1 argument.
Can be set to NONE to suppress header details. @USER.DEF.RTN(OutHeader).

Allowed only if IN.OUT.TYPE is set to OUT. Defines the header details of the file being processed. Should translate all the keywords as mentioned in IN.FILE.NAME. Can also be user defined routine with ‘@’ prefixed with 1 argument.
Can be set to NONE to suppress header details. @USER.DEF.RTN(OutTrailer).
This field used to configure the response mapping for real-time inward messages.
This is a additional option or real-time inward processing instead of sending the OFS response user can have a option to send the formatted response.
The field should keyed in only for IN.OUT.TYPE set as OUT and MODE.OF.TXN set as ONLINE.
The value attached in this field should be a record ID in DFE.ONNECTOR.DETAILS.
This field should configured with a valid URL address for a WEBSERVICE call.
Validation Rules
This field should be configured when IN.OUT.TYPE set as OUT and MODE.OF.TXN set as ONLINE.
The field should keyed in only for IN.OUT.TYPE set as OUT and MODE.OF.TXN set as ONLINE.
This field should configured with a valid record ID from DFE.TRANSFORM
This field should input when the record format set as XML.
The field should keyed in only for IN.OUT.TYPE set as IN.
Define a valid company code, this will defaulted in the OFS message to process the transaction for specific company
Also user defined routine can be attached under this field.
The field should keyed in only for IN.OUT.TYPE set as OUT and MODE.OF.TXN set as ONLINE.
This field should hold the JMS connection factory of WEBSPHERE.
The field should keyed in only for IN.OUT.TYPE set as OUT and MODE.OF.TXN set as ONLINE.
This field should hold the MQ Request Queue.
The field should keyed in only for IN.OUT.TYPE set as OUT and MODE.OF.TXN set as ONLINE.
This field should hold the MQ Response Queue.
The field should keyed in only for IN.OUT.TYPE set as OUT and MODE.OF.TXN set as ONLINE.
This field should hold the number of count to post the message for FINAL.MSG.SYNC_FINAL.MSG.ASYNC.
This is yes_no field to define with the processing method in OFS.
If this field enabled with Y the OFS header will updated with VALIDATE while posting OFS
If this field enabled with N the OFS header will updated with PROCESS while posting OFS
This field used to block the system from processing the duplicate files for the same day.
Validation Rule
This field should hold the value YES or BLANK.
IF its marked as YES system will not check the duplicates it will simply process.
IF its marked as BLANK system by default block the file duplicates.
